nodes.label: Mind Map
nodes.description: A diagram used to visually organize information into a hierarchy, showing relationships among pieces of the whole.

nodes.label: Diagram
nodes.description: A symbolic representation of information using visualization techniques.

nodes.label: Hierarchy
nodes.description: A system or organization in which people or groups are ranked one above the other according to status or authority.

nodes.label: Tree Structure
nodes.description: A way of representing the hierarchical nature of a structure in a graphical form.

nodes.label: Tony Buzan
nodes.description: British popular psychology author and television personality who popularized the term 'mind map'.

nodes.label: Concept Map
nodes.description: A type of diagram that depicts suggested relationships between concepts.

nodes.label: Personal Knowledge Base
nodes.description: An information management system used to store, organize, and retrieve personal information.

nodes.label: Mind-mapping Software
nodes.description: Software used to create, represent, and organize information visually and hierarchically.

nodes.label: Note-taking
nodes.description: The practice of recording information from different sources and platforms.

nodes.label: Radial Map
nodes.description: A method of displaying data that starts from a central point and extends outward.

links.relationship: A mind map is a type of diagram.
A mind map organizes information into a hierarchy.
A mind map uses a tree structure to show relationships among ideas.
The term 'mind map' was popularized by Tony Buzan.
A mind map is a type of concept map.
A mind map can be part of a personal knowledge base system.
Mind maps can be created using mind-mapping software.
Mind maps can be used as a method of note-taking.
Mind maps are based on a radial map denoting relationships with a central concept.

metadata.name: MindMap
metadata.description: This is a generated graph from the mind map wikipedia entry.
